div.span: Today, Gov. Cuomo has announced school closures in New York State until May 15. You will be notified if there are any further updates to this date.

div.div: Last night, in order to limit the spread of the Coronavirus, Governor Cuomo issued an Executive Order that will cancel all classes and before and after-school programs at all Nassau County schools from March 16-April 1, 2020. Therefore, despite the fact that we have no confirmed Coronavirus cases reported in our schools, March 16, 2020 through April 1, 2020, all classes and programs in the Malverne schools are cancelled and none of our schools will be accessible to any of our students.

Ongoing deep cleaning of all of our schools and facilities took place again on Monday. In addition, our administrators will meet tomorrow to plan ways in which our students can continue their coursework during the next two weeks. Your child's principal will contact you as soon as these plans are final. For those whose children rely on our free and reduced lunch program, the district is working with local officials to ensure that these important meals are available. Specific information will be forthcoming..

As you know, this continues to be an exceptionally trying time for all of us. Thank you for your ongoing patience and support as we continue to adjust to ever-changing information regarding this health emergency and strive to protect the health and welfare of our Malverne students, staff and community.
